lexUnit.name: drift.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be carried slowly by a current of air or water.

sentence.text: The smoke was drifting slowly across the farm buildings in the still air .
The vapour , rising over the North Sea , drifted slowly eastwards to heap white and grey thunderheads above the coast .
In mid-stream Meg let Ben take the oars from her , changing seats with him nimbly as the boat drifted slowly about .
He 'd made a good start but now he was faltering , and the focus of attention was drifting slowly away from him .
A fine trail of dust dislodged from the door frame and drifted slowly to the ground .
A Radioactive cloud that drifted across Britain after a fire at the Windscale nuclear factory in Cumbria in 1957 may have killed hundreds of people .
The problem results when acid rainclouds drifting across moorland come into contact with the branches of conifers .
The rain was still drifting across the distant mountain range when they left the hotel , blurring their outlines , obscuring the lough .
One cool September Saturday , as the first snowflakes drifted quietly across the picture window , a white-faced , rather exhausted Isobel sat sewing in her living-room .
Laughter drifted across the water as the long , high-sided boat made its way out across the lake , the lanterns swinging gently on either side .
A smell , rich , savoury , and unfamiliar was drifting from the flat .
Dust spurted and drifted from their hooves and the bright sun flashed cruel and beautiful from their drawn sabres .
Once , when stationed at Pulham in Norfolk , his commanding officer told him that a naval airship was drifting from the North Sea entirely out of control , as both its engines had broken down .
He sat back in the armchair and watched the smoke drifting upwards from his pipe towards the gas lamp .
Music drifted from open windows and traffic droned down the King 's Road .
The tide was turning and he could see debris drifting downstream in the yellow afternoon light towards the River Gate , a mere hundred yards downstream .
There is no consistent air movement , and the seeds are drifting outwards in all directions from the tree .
Alternatively the capsule might be drifting in the weak gravitational field of intergalactic space .
The Saturday afternoon was fine , with soft clouds drifting in a blue sky .
Every angle , line and contour were gently rounded as though the snow had drifted slightly in the wind .
The boat was drifting into the current , the long poles dipping in the dark water and pushing her away .
The light faded , leaves fell , and a fine snow drifted through the air , vanishing below her .
As I slept off the last of my baggitis , sweet visions of castles , fountains and autumn leaves drifted through my dreams .
Each time she thought she had caught hold of the essential man he turned out to be as nebulous as the sea mist drifting through her fingers .
In both , the characters drift somnambulistically through life , unconsciously impelled by emotions of which not only they , but also the author , can give little or no account .
A cool breeze drifted through the open window , carrying with it the sound of water trickling softly from the old stone fountain they 'd painstakingly renovated in the inner courtyard .
He whisped out of his clothes , which hung man-shaped in the air for a second and then drifted to the floor .
Remember that if the glider is drifting towards an obstruction this can only be stopped by banking away from it and not by just applying the rudder .
The familiar odours of onions and fat , roasted coffee and decaying fish drifted towards the Thames .
The reports drifting out of Baghdad suggest that an accord of some sort is on the way .
But this year , it has finally decided to flower profusely , forming brownish clouds which drift hazily over the bush .
` Listen , " he murmured , his warm breath drifting over her cheek .
With only the faintest possible graze of the fender , the dinghy drifted against her .
Hence , the continents , islands , and submarine ranges drift on these thinner plates , like conveyor belts .
The scents of its rare grasses and reeds drift gently on the wind bringing calm and tranquillity to its banks .
The ash cloud drifted at somewhere between twenty-five and sixty kilometres per hour , and it covered in all more than two million square kilometres of the South American continent .
The empty parachute took more than twenty minutes to wander and drift all the way down .
Because Mr Ross was unconscious , he had been unable to steer his vessel and the craft had drifted two miles out to sea much further than it was designed to go .
